bug.short_desc: The plug-in path is changed on GIMP preference
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
No meter what I do, the plugin is not found by gimp after the install.
After ln -s /usr/share/gimp/2.0/plug-ins/layer-via-copy-cut.py ~/.gimp-2.8/plug-ins/layer-via-copy-cut.py it works.
May the RPMs be fixed so the linking to usersapce is not needed?

(In reply to jiri vanek from comment #0) > No meter what I do, the plugin is not found by gimp after the install. > > > After ln -s /usr/share/gimp/2.0/plug-ins/layer-via-copy-cut.py > ~/.gimp-2.8/plug-ins/layer-via-copy-cut.py it works. > > > May the RPMs be fixed so the linking to usersapce is not needed?
It sounds like an issue with RPM on rawhide. If you look at the spec file, nothing suggest manually ln -s as it is done automatically.
https://paste.fedoraproject.org/401330/32907514/

Sorry. Thats 24. fixing.
I'm not sure what to see in specfile.
This is one file pacage, and file is installed as:
http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/gimp-layer-via-copy-cut.git/tree/gimp-layer-via-copy-cut.spec#n29
Unluckily, it looks gimp no longer looks for plugins in here.

(In reply to jiri vanek from comment #2) > Sorry. Thats 24. fixing. > > I'm not sure what to see in specfile. > > > This is one file pacage, and file is installed as: > > http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/gimp-layer-via-copy-cut.git/tree/ > gimp-layer-via-copy-cut.spec#n29 > > > Unluckily, it looks gimp no longer looks for plugins in here.
It is likely a bug related to gimp. Looking at the Preference -> Folders, plugins path is listed but somehow failed to display this plugins i.e layer-via-copy-gut. Assigning to Gimp.
Revisiting this bug. The the plug-ing path has changed upstream and I managed to fix it.
